bobbles inside out so that they are poking to the outside of the work row 14 single_crochet 20 around 20 stitches eyes now that the front two feet are in you can see where the top and middle of the head is place your safety eyes in between row 7 and 8 with about 2-3 stitches between them stuff the head firmly and shape row 15 *increase single_crochet 4* repeat around 24 stitches row 16-21 single_crochet 24 around 24 stitches row 22 *decrease single_crochet 4* repeat around 20 stitches row 23 single_crochet 2 8dc bobble in next stitch single_crochet 5 8dc bobble in next stitch single_crochet 11 20 stitches push the bobbles inside out so that they are poking to the outside of the work row 24 *decrease single_crochet 2* repeat around 15 stitches stuff place more stuffing in the body light stuffing will allow the toy to sit flatter firmer stuffing will give him a rounder shape if you stuff too firmly the belly might stop the crocodile sitting flat on all 4 feet criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-crocodile-alligator row 25 *decrease single_crochet 3* repeat around 12 stitches row 26-27 single_crochet 12 around 12 stitches row 28 *decrease single_crochet 4* repeat around 10 stitches row 29 single_crochet 10 around 10 stitches row 30 *decrease single_crochet 3* repeat around 8 stitches row 31-33 single_crochet 8 around 8 stitches stuff place more stuffing in the tail you can pull out your stitch markers/scrap yarn here too row 34 *decrease single_crochet 2* repeat around 6 stitches row 35-36 single_crochet 6 around 6 stitches close cut the thread and leave a short tail use a needle to thread around the outside of the remaining 6 stitches and pull closed thread this tail back into the body scutes i embroider the scutes or ridges on the back using one piece of yarn i thread it in from underneath the crocodile so the knot can be hidden later start with the nose i thread the yarn up through the head and stitch in two nostrils alternatively thread the yarn to the side of the mouth and stitch in teeth all the way around i then thread the yarn to come out on top of the neck slightly to one side i weave the yarn back and forth along the row down the body of the croc to the tail work your way back up to the neck again trying to mirror the stitches on the other side thread the yarn back down to the same place that the beginning end of the yarn is poking out of tie these two strands together thread both back into the body of the croc and tug slightly that little knot will pop back into the body snip the loose ends
